div.p:
College of Arts and Science
Aided By Govt of Kerala
Affiliated to the University of Calicut
Reacredited by NAAC with A Grade

The National Cadet Corps is Youth Wing of Armed Forces with its Headquarters at New Delhi, Delhi, India. It is open to school and college students on voluntary basis. National Cadet Corps is a Tri-Services Organization, comprising the Army, Navy and Air Wing, engaged in grooming the youth of the country into disciplined and patriotic citizens. The National Cadet Corps in India is a voluntary organization which recruits cadets from high schools, higher secondary, colleges and universities all over India. The Cadets are given basic military training in small arms and parades. The officers and cadets have no liability for active military service once they complete their course.NCC is the largest uniformed youth organization. Its motto is 'Unity and Discipline'.

NCC Motto The discussion for motto of NCC was started in 11th central advisory meeting (CAD) held on 11 August 1978. At that time there were many mottos in mind like "Duty and Discipline"; "Duty, Unity and Discipline"; "Duty and Unity"; "Unity and Discipline". later, at the 12thCAD meeting on 12 Oct 1980 they selected and declared "Unity and Discipline" as motto for the NCC.[4] In living up to its motto, the NCC strives to be and is one of the greatest cohesive forces of the nation, bringing together the youth hailing from different parts of the country and moulding them into united, secular and disciplined citizens of the nation.

EMEA College NCC Unit has been established in 2013 with an intake capacity of total 54 cadets enrolling 18 cadets every year. The enrolment for the year 2018-19 was done on 30th July 2018. More than 120 students turned out, and 18 students were enlisted following physical test and an interview. Crowning ceremony was held and 13 cadets were given ranks and subsequent duties

NCC Cadets at EMEA College conducted a candle tribute programme to commemorate the sacrifice of the Pulwama martyrs who got murdered after the Pulwama Attack on Sunday, 14/02/2019. EMEA College NCC had conducted a massive homage programme in February 2019 joining hands with CISF, JCI and Kerala Police to pay tributes to the sublime sacrifice of CRPF to this nation.
On 26th January 2021, as part of Republic Day Celebrations, EMEA College NCC Unit conducted the following programs.
As part of Swachhatha Pakhwada Mission, NCC cadets of EMEA college conducted following programs on 12/12/2020

National Cadet Corps NCC of EMEA College took the anti-drug pledge as part of the Nasha Mukt Bharat campaign on 15 October 2020. The campaign was conducted online via zoom platform. There were 32 cadets, and the pledge was recited by Lt Abdul Rasheed, NCC officer, and the cadets repeated after.

A webinar on National Education policy 2020 has been conducted by National Cadet Corps (NCC), EMEA College of Arts and Science, Kondotty on Tuesday, 13th October, 2020. It was organised online via Google Meet platform. The webinar started as per the schedule at 4 pm and finished at 5.30 pm.

Forty parades were conducted. All cadets took part in the CATC camp held either at Calicut or Tirur. Sgt. Sabeel participated in the Mountaineering at Andhra Pradesh. UO Maharoof participated in the trekking camp at Dehra Dun. Two cadets took part in the prestigious Army Attachment Camp at Coimbatore. Two cadets participated in the National Integration camp conducted at Alleppy and Karnataka. Cdt. Syama won gold medal in firing and participated in the inter group competitions. L/Cl Nimesh was selected and participated in the inter-group shooting competitions. 18 cadets wrote B certificate e Read More

NCC conducted an anti-narcotics campaign along with Vimukthi of Excises Department. B Harikumar delivered a session. It also conducted an eye-check up camp in association with Al-Salama Eye Hospital on campus.

During the flood days, NCC took charge of Kondotty traffic along with Kondotty Police. NCC Cadets visited major relief camps such as Tirur, Kolappuram and Areekode and distributed relief aids and kits.NCC cadets assisted the Rapid Action Force in assisting traffic routes on the post flood cleaning works. NCC girl cadets along with boys worked hard cleaning houses at Feroke, Kondotty and Areekode.
Independence rally was conducted at Kumminiparamb on 15th August. Cadets distributed sweets to the public on the same day.

div.h2: EMEA College of Arts and Science
div.p: Kumminiparamaba PO
Kondotty, Malappuram Dt.
Kerala - India
E-mail : mail@emeacollege.ac.in
